channel.title: New computer
channel.description:
budget: $850
my only requisites are that RAM is 6GB+, hdd is 500GB+ and dual monitors
give me good advice please!
edit: current list: [url=http://accessories.us.dell.com/sna/productdetail.aspx?cs=19&c=us&l=en&sku=S2209X2&dgc=CJ&cid=24471&lid=566643&acd=10495476-227502-A11A0A0B46A05184929A0]Monitors[/url] = $300 [s][url=http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0011FQUQG/ref=olp_product_details?ie=UTF8&me=&seller=]Mouse and Keyboard[/url] = $140[/s] $70-90

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:14, topic:313862”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=410354.msg3038370#msg3038370 date=1258915361]

I don’t know about USA, but here a perfectly good laser mouse is $5.
[/quote]Wut. Laser-mice aren’t that cheap, optical however is.

Other than greater sensitivity, is there any other advantages to a laser over an optical mouse?[/quote]Not really. I never said there was tho

Read full topic

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:3, topic:313862”]Ridiculous price for mouse/keyboard.

Just buy a $50 laser-mouse and a $20 keyboard or sumthin like that.[/quote]
This. If you want to save even more money, just get one of those shit ball mice. But a laser mouse WILL definatly last you a long time though.

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

keyboard means nothing, get a quality mouse for sure (around 50$) as johan said, but keyboards 10-20$ is fine. Getting a decent build for 800$ is fine if you didn’t request 6gigs, or an expensive mouse/keyboard.

Can you shop from newegg?
